data: For practice guidelines, refer to Decision Support Tool (DST): Hypoxemia
Initiate the minimal amount of oxygen necessary to reverse signs / symptoms of hypoxia
Routine, Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 greater than 92 %, nasal Cannula, 1 - 6 L/min. NIA for Hypoxemia
Routine, Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 greater than 88 - 92 %, Nasal Cannula, No more than 1 - 2  L/min.  For COPD / Bleomycin patients. NIA for Hypoxemia
Routine, Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 greater than 92 %, Simple Mask, 5 - 10 L/min. NIA for Hypoxemia
Routine,  Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 greater than 92 %, Non-Rebreather Mask 10 - 15 L/min. NIA for Hypoxemia
Urgent, Reason for Consult: For SpO2 less than 92% with oxygen therapy 6L Nasal Cannula or Simple Mask
Urgent, Reason for Consult: COPD patient SpO2 is less than 88% and symptomatic
Urgent, Reason for Consult: Acute respiratory distress
Urgent, Reason for Consult: Sudden onset of symptoms of hypoxemia
Notify treating provider of ongoing therapy
